msItem.note: The third discourse of Balai must have been a very short one, as only four leaves are missing, and thefirst discourse of Jacob of Batnaeis imperfect at the beginning.

Table of contents

quote.sic: ܐܣܬܝܟ ܒܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܡܐܡܪ̈ܐ ܚܡܫܐ ܕܗܝܡܢܘܬܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܦܪܝܡ. ܘܬܘܒ ܬܠܬܐ̣ ܕܡܪܝ ܟܣܣܛܘܣ. ܘܬܘܒ ܕܡܪܝ ܒܣܝܠܝܣ ܐܫܬܐ. ܘܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܠܘܬ ܓܪܓܪܝܣ. ܘܬܘܒ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܝܣܚܩ ܐܪ̈ܒܥܐ. ܘܬܘܒ ܕܡܪܝ ܒܠܝ ܕܝܘܣܦ ܬܠܬܐ. ܘܬܘܒ ܕܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܚܡܫܐ. ܕܗܘܝܢ ܟܠܗܘܢ ܡܐܡܪ̈ܐ ܥܣܪ̈ܝܢ ܘܫܒܥܐ.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 10 3/4 in. by 8 1/2, consisting of 154 leaves, some of which are slightly stained and torn, especially foll. 1, 2, 8, 10, and 154. The quires, 16 in number, were originally signed with both arithmetical figures and letters (see in particular foll. 20a,60a, and 136a).Four leaves are wanting after fol. 123, and one after fol. 154. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 31 to 38 lines. The writing is a good, regular Estrangēla of the vith cent.

collation.p: The quires, 16 in number, were originally signed with both arithmetical figures and letters (see in particular foll.20a,60a, and136a).

item.p: Some of the leaves are slightly stained and torn, especially foll.1,2,8,10, and154.
Four leaves are wanting after fol.123, and one after fol.154.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 31 to 38 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is a good, regular Estrangēla of thevith cent.

item.label: Colophon
item.p: The note that originally followed the doxology has been erased, but enough remains to show that this volume was written at the expense of certain monks.

p.quote: ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܒܗ ܢܨܠܐ ܥܠܝܗܘܢ ܡܛܠ ܡܪܢ܀ ܐܝܬܝܗܘܢ ܕܝܢ ܐܚ̈ܐ ܗܠܝܢ...

item.p: Over the first part ofitis now written in a more modern hand:

quote.sic: ܐܝܬܝܗ ܕܝܢ ܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܕܡ̈܏ܐܡ ܕܕܝܪ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܣܘܪ̈ܝܐܐ ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩܝܛܝܢ ܗܘ ܕܩܪܐ.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Cyril of Alexandria. The third part of the treatise of Cyril of Alexandria on Worship in Spirit and in Truth, comprising books ix.-xii. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.author: Cyril of Alexandria
msItem.title: The third part of the treatise of Cyril of Alexandria on Worship in Spirit and in Truth, comprising books ix.-xii.
msItem.rubric: ܟܬܒܐ ܕܬܠܬܐ ܕܛܘܒܢܐ ܩܘܪܝܠܘܣ ܪܫܐ ܕܐܦܣ̈ܩܘܦܐ ܕܐܠܟܣܢܕܪܝܐ ܕܥܠ ܣܓܕܬܐ ܕܒܪܘܚ ܘܒܫܪܪܐ܀

listBibl.bibl: Opera, ed. Aubert, t. i., pp. 287-450

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 10 5/8 in. by 8 3/8, consisting of 104 leaves (Add. 12,166, foll. 155—258), some of which, are much stained and soiled. The quires, 11 in number, are signed with both letters and arithmetical figures. Each page is divided into 3 columns, of from 27 to 34 lines. This volume is written in a good, regular Estrangělā, and dated A. Gr. 864, A.D. 553

collation.p: The quires, 11 in number, are signed with both letters and arithmetical figures.

item.p: Some of the leaves are much stained and soiled.

layout.p: Each page is divided into 3 columns, of from 27 to 34 lines.

handNote.desc: This volume is written in a good, regular Estrangělā, and datedA. Gr. 864,A.D. 553.See additions.

item.label: Colophon
item.p: On fol. 258a, after the doxology, we read the following note, giving the date and stating that the volume was written atEdessa, at the expense of the deaconThomas ofZěmārtā Castra .

quote.sic: ܢܗܘܐ ܕܘܟܪܢܐ ܩܕܡ ܐܠܗܐ ܘܡܫܝܚܗ ܘܪܘܚܗ ܚܝܐ ܘܩܕܝܫܐ ܠܫܡܫܐ ܬܐܘܡܐ ܕܡܢ ܙܡܪܬܐ ܩܣܛܪܐ ܕܐܬܚܦܛ ܘܥܒܕ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܠܝܘܬܪܢܐ ܕܢܦܫܐ ܘܠܫܘܘܙܒܐ ܕܚܝ̈ܘܗܝ. ܕܠܐܗܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܛܠܬܗ ܐܬܚܦܛ ܘܥܒܕ ܢܫܘܝܘܗܝ ܏ܘܫ. ܐܙܕܒܢ ܕܝܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܒܝܘܡ ܐܝܪܚ ܐܝܠܘܠ ܕܫܢܬܐ ܬܡܢܡܐܐ ܘܫܬܝܢ ܘܐܪܒܥ ܡܢ ܐܘܪܗܝ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ♰

item.p: Below this a monk, residing in the village ofܠܙܝܐ, has written:

p.quote: ܐܠܗܐ ܥܒܕ ܪ̈ܚܡ̣ܐ ܥܠ ܚܛ̇ܝܐ ܕܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܣܘܪܓܕܐ ܕܐܝܬܘ ܛܘܒܢܐ ܕ̇ܝܡ ܒܩܪܝܬܐ ܠܙܝܐ ܐܢ ܘܐܡܝܢ ܘܐܡܝܢ

item.p: At the top of the page, in a current hand of thexth cent., there is written:

quote.sic: ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܩܘܕܝܠܘܣ ܕܕܝܪܐ ܕܣܘܪ̈ܝܝܐ ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩܝܛܝ. ܐܠܐ ܟܠ ܡܢ ܕܫܩܠ ܒܐܝ̇ܕܐ ܥܠ̣ܬܐ ܕܗ̣ܝ ܠܐ ܫܠܝܛ ܠܗ ܡܢ ܠܐܠܗܐ ܕܢܗܘܐ ܠܘܬ[ܗ] ܝܬܝܪ ܡܢ ܫܬܐ ܝܪ̈ܚܝܢ. ܘܐܢ ܡܡܪ[ܚ] ܘܥܒܪ ܬܚܝܐ ܚܪܡܐ ܐܝܬܘܗܝ♰

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.
